incidents.name: Exchange Catalog is unable to complete data indexing communication.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. There is a backlog of requests being processed, and engineers are actively monitoring progress
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently looking into a problem where the Exchange Catalog is unable to communicate with other components for data indexing purposes. While the Exchange Catalog has a temporary solution in place, API Manager might not have similar workarounds available. Consequently, if API Manager depends on other components for displaying new APIs and Custom Policies, these items may not appear as expected. We are working to resolve this issue and will share updates as soon as possible.

incidents.name: MuleSoft RPA Intelligent Doc Processing service seeing intermittent issues.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Customers may experience 5xx errors while using MuleSoft RPA Intelligent Doc Processing service. Engineering teams are investigating and putting measures in place to reduce the impact/resolve the issue.
Customers who use the Intelligent Doc Processing services may see a 5xx error intermittently. Engineers are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Composer login page not reachable

incident_updates.body: We have applied a fix and this is now completely mitigated, customers might have experienced impact while interacting with MuleSoft composer login page between 11:40 PM PT on May 15th and 12:30 AM PT on May 16th.

MuleSoft Composer customers experienced errors while interacting with the login page between 11:40 PM PT on May 15th and 12:30 AM PT on May 16th. At the moment the login page is fully functional, we are monitoring the service.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
This issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Anypoint & Composer platform users seeing intermittent 503 errors

incident_updates.body:
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_RCA: MuleSoft Access Management Performance Degradation in US Region - Friday, May 10, 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=001934898&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

We have successfully  mitigated the issue, and we don't have active impact, all MuleSoft services are fully operational, MuleSoft engineering is working on a permanent fix to ensure this issue is permanently resolved.

incidents.name: API Manager and Analytics degraded experience

incident_updates.body: As of 06:52, API Analytics is working normally. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.

We have seen full recovery in API Manager, Exchange and Scheduler.
API Analytics continues trending towards full recovery.

Our teams continue to monitor.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We continue to observe degraded conditions in several platform features:

- API Manager may display errors or slowness
- API Analytics may be delayed or display a blank page when fetching reports
- CloudHub 2 schedulers may not be displayed correctly, running of schedules not impacted
- Exchange may display errors or slowness

Our engineering team continues to work on resolving this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Customers may experience errors or delays while using API Manager and API Analytics. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Performance degradation in CloudHub services

incident_updates.body:
For approximately an hour starting shortly after 13:00 PT, there was an event causing performance degradation across CloudHub services. Some app schedules may not have triggered during this time.

This issue is now resolved, and this is a retroactive posting.

incidents.name: Runtime Manager Scheduler not showing in UI

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved, if you are still experiencing the impact described please see the previous post on steps to take to resolve the situation for your application.

We have identified the issue that was causing newly deployed applications with schedulers are not deploying the schedulers in the Schedules page of the applications. Any applications deployed between 8:09 AM Pacific time and 7:32 PM Pacific time may still be experiencing this issue.  Any new applications deployed after 7:32PM Pacific time are functioning fine.  We are moving this incident to monitoring.

If you have an application that is not displaying the schedulers in the Schedules UI page when you expect it to, you can take the following steps to correct that situation:

* you have to publish a new version of your asset to exchange
* then redeploy your application using the new version of the asset

Optionally, If the applications are deployed directly from the Runtime Manager UI without assets published manually then you can upload the same JAR file in the applications settings page.

Customers may experience issues with new deployments of a mule application that contains Schedulers to a Cloudhub 2.0 Private Space from the Runtime Manager UI after deployment they may not be able to manage the schedules through the Anypoint Runtime Manager UI.  We are continuing to work on identifying the cause of this issue.
Customers may experience issues where the scheduler does not show in the Runtime UI. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Retroactive Post: Object Store Stats unavailable

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an issue from 2024-03-22 01:25 Pacific to 2024-03-22 01:51 Pacific, where requests were not received by one of our services.

This affected Object Store Stats resulting in 5XX errors when customers tried to access that feature. Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

incidents.name: Anypoint Partner Manager Transmission Status not Visible in UI

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved outbound transmissions are now appearing as expected in the Partner Manager UI.

Inbound acknowledgements for outbound transmissions with multiple messages fail to reconcile against corresponding outbound transmission. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is currently being implemented.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We have discovered an issue where customers may not be able to see that status of outbound transmission with multiple messages from the Partner Manager activity UI. Transmissions are functioning as expected however the UI is not displaying the status. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: MuleSoft Composer Flows Experiencing Intermittent Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Composer users may intermittently see an error in the UI when performing a subset of operations like listing of flows and pulling Flow details. Flows already running are not impacted.

incidents.name: Issue Creating Private Spaces

incident_updates.body: As of 14:23 (PT) the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
This issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigating this issue. We have learned that impact is limited to customers creating new private spaces specifically within the us-east-2 region.
We are currently investigating an issue where Private Space customers are not able to create private networks from Runtime Manager UI.

incidents.name: API Manager is failing to apply new policies to applications.

incident_updates.body:
As of 04:07 Pacific, the impact to API Manager is resolved. API Gateway is now able to retrieve and apply all the configured policies. 

API Gateway might continue to show errors for the application of previous versions of the policy but this has no impact on the gateway and the errors will disappear with a restart.
After the actions taken by our technical teams, we are seeing a steady decrease in the error rate and expect to be fully out of impact within the next hour.
We have validated a fix for this incident in our lower environments and are working to deploy it now.  Once deployed and we see the error rates dropping, we will update to monitoring.

This is a retroactive note at 7:27 PM Pacific time, we noted an inaccuracy in our original posting where we explained that existing applications without policy updates would continue to operate normally.  This turned out to be incorrect.  A status post was made at that time on our EU Status site, but it was not communicated here on the US Status site.  Please refer to the previous message for remediation steps while we work to resolve the overall situation.

We have addressed the backend issue causing the errors that have generated this incident, while we work on restoring the service fully, we have identified a remediation step that can be taken to restore your applications to their expected performance.

If your Mule Gateway is currently affected, proceed to restart your Mule Runtime.

If you are unsure if your gateway is currently affected, you can review the logs to see if there is any occurrence of an error message like:

Error deploying policy <POLICY_NAME> to application <APPLICATION_NAME>
com.mulesoft.mule.runtime.gw.policies.template.exception.PolicyTemplateAssetException: Unexpected error when requesting template metadata for <POLICY_NAME>

If you see occurrences of the above error message then you should proceed to restart your Mule Runtime.

Existing applications with the policies will continue to operate smoothly. However, in the event of application restarts or when deploying new apps, there is a risk that they may encounter difficulties in downloading and applying API Manager policies, resulting in deployment failures.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Customers may experience errors while using applying new policies to existing and new applications. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Retroactive Post: UI options missing Partner Manager

incident_updates.body: We experienced an issue from 2024-03-04 18:18 UTC (10:18 AM PST) to 19:43 UTC (11:43AM PST) , where customers were not able to navigate or view options within Partner Manager. Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

incidents.name: Issue with usage reports in CloudHub 2.0

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Customers running Mule apps on CloudHub 2.0 who are monitoring usage in the usage reports may observe missing Network Bytes data from September 2023 onward

incidents.name: A small number of customers may experience errors while accessing ObjectStore v2 in the US East Region for runtimes.

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customers may have seen intermittent 5xx errors on Object Store V2 in the US Region - Sunday, February 11, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customers-may-have-seen-intermittent-5xx-errors-on-Object-Store-V2-in-the-US-Region-Sunday-February-11-2024) _- Final_

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
As of 12:37 AM Pacific time the incident was mitigated and has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - us-east-1

incident_updates.body: Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - us-east-1

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team is continuing to work to address the issue and restore service to its expected state.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - us-east-1

incident_updates.body: Customers may experience 503 errors while using ObjectStore V2. Engineering teams are investigating and putting measures in place to reduce the impact/resolve the issue. No customer action is required at this point.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - us-east-1

incident_updates.body: A small number of customers may experience errors while accessing ObjectStore V2 in the US East region for runtimes.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - us-east-1

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with API Analytics showing incomplete data

incident_updates.body: As of 5:58 PM Pacific time API Analytics ingestion returned to normal operation.  The cause of the performance situation was identified and has been resolved.  Operations for API Analytics are back within expected performance.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
Customers may experience problems with API Analytics showing incomplete data. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: CloudHub 1 Business Group Runtime Options not visible

incident_updates.body: The issue was resolved at 17:26 PT.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

This issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. A work around has been found for some customers.
If you have Global Deployments for your org, please enable "Global Deployments" for your corresponding suborg (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Set-Global-Deployments-on-Business-Groups). 

Note: API and Maven deployments are not affected.
Some customers may be experiencing issues seeing Runtime options when deploying CloudHub 1 applications in Runtime Manager.

incidents.name: RTF is in a Degraded State

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Runtime Fabric agents were in a degraded state in the US Region - Friday, February 02, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Runtime-Fabric-agents-were-in-a-degraded-state-in-the-US-Region-Friday-February-02-2024)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
As of 12:30 PM PT the issue was resolved, at which point customers are no longer seeing RTF in a degraded state.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are investigating an issue on where RTF is a Degraded State, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: CloudHub | January 2024 Runtime and DLB Monthly Patches were not Applied in US Control Plane Automatically

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix/resolution is in the works.

We are investigating an issue affecting CloudHub Monthly Auto-upgrade, we will provide more information as soon as we can.   

Affected Customers are directed to follow the below link - Article Link https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/CloudHub-January-2024-Runtime-and-DLB-Monthly-Patches-were-not-Applied-in-US-Control-Plane-Automatically

incidents.name: Environments are Erroring Upon Delete

incident_updates.body: As of 14:20 PT (22:20 UTC) the issue has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Customers will experience an error when attempting to delete an environment. Teams are investigating this issue.

incidents.name: New Templates Unable to be Deployed to Partner Manager

incident_updates.body:
The recent issues affecting Partner Manager customers on CloudHub have been successfully resolved. Our teams have addressed the problems that were causing failures in the deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades. We also resolved the difficulties impacting transaction replays.

Please note that runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows were not impacted during this issue.

We appreciate your patience and understanding while we worked to fix these issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using CloudHub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix. This issue also impacts the ability to replay transactions. Runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows are not impacted due to this issue.
Deploying new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using Cloudhub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix.

components.name: Anypoint Partner Manager v2
components.description: Anypoint Partner Manager v2 accelerates customer adoption of B2B integrations by enabling easy configuration and management of their B2B flows

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with Composer creating new or opening and modifying existing flows.

incident_updates.body: As of 10:56 PM UTC the incident was mitigated the issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
Customers may experience problems when they attempt to create a new flow or open/edit an existing flow in the Composer user interface.  There is no impact to running flows.

incidents.name: API Analytics Data Delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are still working on implementing a fix, we will provide more information soon
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
The API Analytics data may not be showing real-time information for some customers; there is a delay in the data display. Teams are currently investigating.

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Anypoint Monitoring for Flex Gateway logs delays in US region - Thursday, January 21, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Anypoint-Monitoring-for-Flex-Gateway-logs-delays-in-US-region-Thursday-January-21-2024)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.
Engineers have identified the cause of the issue and are working towards implementing a fix.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: OpenShift RTF Cert Renewal Issues.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been mitigated and can be fixed by following the below KB:

https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Runtime-Fabric-Cluster-is-Disconnected-or-Degraded-and-Showing-remote-error-tls-unknown-certificate
Customers may experience OpenShift RTF Cert renewal issues; teams are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Errors in CloudHub

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customer applications were unable to deploy or start on schedule in the US Region - Thursday, January 18, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customer-applications-were-unable-to-deploy-or-start-on-schedule-in-the-US-Region-Thursday-January-18-2024)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

Some customers may experience issues with CloudHub applications when:
- managing application schedules
- deploying/redeploying applications

A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results
We are currently investigating the issue
